Thanks David, but I still seem to be having problems.  I now get a
slightly=
 different error trying to run the Matlab toolbox demos.

The error is repr=
oduced below, and involves not being able to convert
the file to CTML.  I t=
ried all the things mentioned at
http://www.cantera.org/ref/ct2ctml_trouble=
.html.  If I reproduce the
offending command line in a shell, python makes =
a .xml file without
complaint.  The ct2ctml.log file is empty regardless of=
 whether it is
run from matlab or the command line.

The test routines runn=
ing from 'make test' are all passed.  I have
installed both Cantera and mat=
lab in my home directory with all files
and directories in both packages ha=
ving write access.

I am now trying to install the older 1.6.0 version of C=
antera, but
have still had no luck.

Any suggestions would be much apprecia=
ted.

Sean

--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, David Goodwin <dgoodwin@...> wr=
ote:
>??? 

************************************************
              =
  Cantera Error!                  
****************************************=
********


Procedure: ct2ctml
Error:   could not convert input file to CTML=
.
 Command line was: 
sleep 1; /usr/bin/python /home/sean/tmp/.cttmp1151230=
349.pyw &>
ct2ctml.log

Error in =3D=3D> XML_Node.XML_Node at 11
   x.id =
=3D ctmethods(10,15,0,src); % newxml(name)

Error in =3D=3D> Solution.Solut=
ion at 30
doc =3D XML_Node('doc',src);

Error in =3D=3D> IdealGasMix at 39
=
       s =3D Solution(a);

Error in =3D=3D> equil at 12
   gas =3D IdealGas=
Mix('gri30.cti');
